decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a variety of disruption spells and removal to control the game, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure. The deck aims to outvalue its opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and generating card advantage. It also includes cards like Witherbloom Command and Lórien Revealed to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's diverse color requirements and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while quickly getting threats onto the board. It utilizes a combination of powerful disruption spells like Force of Will and Stifle, alongside efficient creatures like Grief and Uro. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead, giving it resilience and the ability to repeatedly bring back key threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive and disruptive game plan, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to quickly bring out powerful threats like Phyrexian Dragon Engine and Goblin Rabblemaster to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes a Dragon tribal theme with cards like Molten Duplication and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to put pressure on the opponent. Magus of the Moon and Shatterskull Smashing help control the opponent's resources and maintain board presence.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo, which allows you to mill your opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana and disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your combo. Additionally, cards like Goblin Engineer and Agatha's Soul Cauldron provide alternative ways to find and play your combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a powerful combo finish.

This deck aims to quickly and efficiently dump powerful creatures into the graveyard and then bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating early game advantage. By using cards like Entomb, Faithless Looting, and Reanimate, the deck can get powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty onto the battlefield as early as turn one or two. The key is to outpace the opponent and overwhelm them with threats that they are unprepared to deal with, leading to a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up your graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Grief and Entomb, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. Utilizing cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also has some disruptive elements with Brazen Borrower and Orcish Bowmasters, along with mana denial with Wasteland. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures and control the game with disruption spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Baleful Strix combined with Ninjas like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Stifle and Fatal Push, as well as control elements like Force of Will and Brainstorm to protect its creatures and maintain tempo. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy while enabling flexibility in casting its spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library. It also includes various ways to protect the combo, such as Ensnaring Bridge and counterspells like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast. The deck also includes ways to recur key pieces with cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder. Agatha's Soul Cauldron can be used to gain life and activate abilities of creatures in the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing various fast mana accelerants to generate large amounts of storm count, allowing the player to cast lethal copies of Tendrils of Agony or other spells. It also includes disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and Veil of Summer to counteract opposing disruption. The deck can also utilize Burning Wish to access its sideboard for additional resources. The key strategy is to build up storm count efficiently while managing resources and navigating through opponent's disruption to ultimately win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main theme of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Control - The Rock (Junk) deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while utilizing graveyard interactions and powerful creatures to gain advantage. The deck focuses on using cards like Murderous Cut, Thoughtseize, and Reanimate to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while also utilizing cards like Grief and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure. The inclusion of cards like Oppression Agent and Dauthi Voidwalker further disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to navigate the game effectively.
